meanings.def: having or showing fine personal qualities that people admire, such as courage, honesty and care for others
examples: He died for a noble cause.
She died in a noble cause.
It was very noble of you to go so far to take him home.

meanings.def: belonging to a family of high social rank (= belonging to the nobility)
examples: He was a young man of noble birth.
one of the noblest families in Portugal
Intermarriage between the noble families means that all the counts are related.

meanings.def: very impressive in size or quality
a person who comes from a family of high social rank; a member of the nobility
examples: The cost of the arch was met by Milanese nobles.
The regime was supported by a group of powerful nobles.
